description: prominent cluster of trees in foreground surrounding a small hut; tranquil body of water on LR with smaller, wallless hut on R banks; main landscape in background; towering, columnar mountain with trees, a series of waterfalls, and a small collection of buildings on L edge; poem at URC
inscription: URC, in ink:[ 尽日柴門無客過雨餘苔径緑如羅山禽呼睡春幽寂満院斜陽竹影多]　{Jinjitsu saimon kyaku sugirukoto naku / Ame taikei ni amari midori ra no gotoshi / Sankin sui to haruno yuujaku wo tanoshimi / In ni shayou michi chikuei ooshi} (One additional seal preceding inscription at top right corner. Inscription at top right corner reads, \"At the valley-mouth, my bramble gate is visted by no guest; / after rainfall, fragrant paths have a covering of green. / My mountain lad calls me from sleep, disrupting my tranquil withdrawal: / the whole courtyard is filled with setting sunlight,  / among the bamboo shadows\" (trans. Jonathan Chaves)   (All the day no guest passed the humble gate. / The rain remained the mossy path so that the green appearance is like the sheer texture (textile?). / Mountain birds enjoy the nap and it is a deep calm in spring. / The sunset fills the home and richened the shade of the bamboo. (trans. ??)})
markings: URC, 1: [ 亮印 ]  {Ryō in}; 2: [楳逸 ]  {Baiitsu}; one before inscription, not read
medium: Hanging scroll; ink and light color on paper
signed: URC: [七十又一翁梅逸  ]  {nanaju mata ichi ō Baiitsu}
text:
Baiitsu, a scholar-painter from Nagoya, used a wide variety of brushstrokes and ink tones to build up solid, mountainous masses in this monumental landscape. The misty areas between the peaks and the dense foliage create a lush, peaceful atmosphere. 
The inscription reads: 

At the valley-mouth, my bramble gate is visited by no guest: 
after rainfall, fragrant paths have a covering of green. 
My mountain lad calls me from sleep, 
disturbing my tranquil withdrawal: 
the whole courtyard is filled with setting sunlight, 
among the bamboo shadows.
(trans. Jonathan Chaves)
title: Landscape with Houses in a Ravine
